APFS.UTIL(8) System Manager's Manual APFS.UTIL(8)

NAME

apfs.util —
APFS file system utility

SYNOPSIS

apfs.util -p device removable writable

apfs.util -k device

apfs.util -s device

apfs.util -B

DESCRIPTION

The apfs.util command supports the probing of apfs volumes, getting a volume UUID and setting container and volume UUIDs.

Options:

-p device removable writable
Probe the device to determine whether it contains an apfs volume. The removable and writable arguments are ignored for compatibility with other file system utilities.
-k
Return the UUID of the apfs volume on device.
-s
Set UUIDs for the container and the volume(s) on the device to new random values.
-B
Bootstrap root container by creating and mounting VM volume and mount preboot volume if one exists.

-B cannot be used with -p, -s or -k.

SEE ALSO

diskarbitrationd(8)

HISTORY

The apfs.util utility first appeared in OS X 10.12.
June 1, 2015 Mac OS X
